shell_commands.alias: Date and time {{date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}} to file

platform_specific_commands.default:
echo "Date and time: "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}} >> TestResults.md
# 2023-03-25: This shell command is nowadays only used for testing variable parsing in Obsidian's command palette. It's not anymore executed in the typical testing process.

echo "File name: "{{file_name}} >> TestResults.md
# 2023-03-25: This shell command is nowadays only used for testing variable parsing in Obsidian's command palette. It's not anymore executed in the typical testing process.

# Copy test results to the end of the test report file.
cat TestResults.md >> "../Performed tests/"{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}" (incomplete).md"

# Sleep one second to make sure TestResults.md is not emptied before it's written to the report file.
sleep 1

# Clear the test results file's content.
echo -n "" > TestResults.md

# Rename the test report file
cd "../Performed tests/"
mv {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}" (incomplete).md" {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}\ \({{shell_commands_plugin:plugin-version}}\)\ {{operating_system:name}}\ {{_test_status}}.md

# Sleep one second, otherwise the file opening may be tried before the file had time to rename.
sleep 1

# Open the renamed file in Obsidian (:-1 sets caret to the last line).
echo {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}\ \({{shell_commands_plugin:plugin-version}}\)\ {{operating_system:name}}\ {{_test_status}}.md:-1
platform_specific_commands.win32:
# Copy test results to the end of the test report file.
type TestResults.md >> "..\Performed tests\{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md"

# Sleep one second to make sure TestResults.md is not emptied before it's written to the report file.
sleep 1

# Clear the test results file's content.
Write-Host -NoNewLine > TestResults.md

# Rename the test report file
cd "..\Performed tests\"
ren "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md" "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} ({{shell_commands_plugin:plugin-version}}) {{operating_system:name}} {{_test_status}}.md"

# Sleep one second, otherwise the file opening may be tried before the file had time to rename.
sleep 1

# Open the renamed file in Obsidian (:-1 sets caret to the last line).
echo "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} ({{shell_commands_plugin:plugin-version}}) {{operating_system:name}} {{_test_status}}.md:-1"

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Test non-ASCII characters: Å Ä Ö" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test output to stderr, with exit code 0

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Multiline output" && echo "hides earlier lines." && echo "Only the last line is permanently displayed on the status bar."

platform_specific_commands.win32: echo Windows shell should be CMD: %COMSPEC% >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "This should NOT be written to TestResults.md!!!" {{passthrough:>>}} TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Open the plugin folder in system explorer

platform_specific_commands.default:
# Only call Obsidian URI if event tests are currently being done, and the {{ _test_event_switching_pane }} variable does not yet have a value, because the call will always bring focus to the Obsidian window, which is annoying if it happens regularly. Probably Obsidian has focus when switching panes, but there can be an edge case where user has changed pane and then rapidly switched to another window before the URI call gets completed.
if [ {{_test_events_running}} = "YES" ] && [ {{_test_event_switching_pane}} != "OK" ]
then
    echo "Switching active pane event triggered."
    xdg-open "obsidian://shell-commands/?vault=Shell%20commands%20test&_test_event_switching_pane=OK"
fi

shell_commands.alias: Event: After switching the active pane

platform_specific_commands.default:
# Only call Obsidian URI if event tests are currently being done, and if the {{ _test_event_every_n_seconds }} variable does not yet have a value, because the call will always bring focus to the Obsidian window, which is annoying if it happens regularly.
if [ {{_test_events_running}} = "YES" ] && [ {{_test_event_every_n_seconds}} != "OK" ]
then
    echo "Every 30 seconds event triggered."
    xdg-open "obsidian://shell-commands/?vault=Shell%20commands%20test&_test_event_every_n_seconds=OK"
fi

Test output using Open a file 2
Test output using Open a file 3

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Sandbox/A file that did not exist before : can-create-file"

shell_commands.alias: Test output using Open a file 4
Test output using Open a file 5
Test output using Open a file 6

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Day of week: "{{date:dddd}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt mandatory field: "{{_mandatory_field}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field with a default value: "{{_field_with_default_value}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt optional field: "{{_optional_field}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field using variables: "{{_field_using_variables}} >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.win32: echo "Day of week: {{date:dddd}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt mandatory field: {{_mandatory_field}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field with a default value: {{_field_with_default_value}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt optional field: {{_optional_field}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field using variables: {{_field_using_variables}}" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test custom variables and a prompt

platform_specific_commands.default:
cd ..
if [ {{event_file_name}} = "CreatedNote.md" ]
then
    python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "file-created"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_folder_name}} = "CreatedFolder" ]
then
    python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "folder-created"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_file_name}} = "DeletableNote.md" ]
then
   python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "file-deleted"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_folder_name}} = "DeletableFolder" ]
then
   python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "folder-deleted"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_file_name}} = "ModifiableNote.md" ]
then
    python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "file-content-modified"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_file_name}} = "MovableNote.md" ]
then
    python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "file-moved"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_folder_name}} = "MovableFolder" ]
then
   python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "folder-moved"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_file_name}} = "RenamedNote.md" ]
then
    python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "file-renamed"
fi

cd ..
if [ {{event_folder_name}} = "RenamedFolder" ]
then
   python3 Assets/Scripts/EventVariableTests.py "folder-renamed"
fi
echo "Custom variable 1: "{{_uri_custom_variable_1}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Custom variable 2: "{{_uri_custom_variable_2}} >> TestResults.md

echo Multiline >> TestResults.md
echo shell >> TestResults.md
echo command >> TestResults.md

echo "Realtime 1"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 2"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 3"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 4"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 5"

echo "Realtime 1" >&2
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 2" >&2
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 3" >&2
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 4" >&2
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 5" >&2
platform_specific_commands.win32:
Write-Error "Realtime 1"
sleep 1
Write-Error "Realtime 2"
sleep 1
Write-Error "Realtime 3"
sleep 1
Write-Error "Realtime 4"
sleep 1
Write-Error "Realtime 5"

sleep 1
echo "Realtime 2: Caret position"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 3: Caret position"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 4: Caret position"
sleep 1
echo "Realtime 5: Caret position"

echo "Builtin variable's global default value: {{event_title}}" >> TestResults.md
echo "Custom variable's global default value: {{_variable_with_default_value}}" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test file menu event variables (excluding event_file_content and event_note_content)

platform_specific_commands.win32:
# Use printf instead of echo, because echo works in PowerShell and CMD.EXE, but printf doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in PowerShell/CMD.EXE instead of WSL.
printf "Hello from WSL!\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "You wanted to output this: "{{_wsl_test_variable}}"\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Variable escaping should use unix style escaping: "{{passthrough:+-*/*}}"\n" >> TestResults.md

# Use printf instead of echo, because echo works in PowerShell and CMD.EXE, but printf doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in PowerShell/CMD.EXE instead of MinGW-w64.
printf "Hello from MinGW-w64!\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Vault path: "{{vault_path}}"\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Variable escaping should use unix style escaping: "{{passthrough:+-*/*}}"\n" >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo. Hello from CMD.EXE via Wine! >> TestResults.md & REM Use echo. instead of normal echo, because echo works in Bash etc, but echo. doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in Bash instead of Wine+CMD.EXE.

platform_specific_commands.default:
# Reset result variables and indicate that event tests are running.
xdg-open 'obsidian://shell-commands/?vault=Shell%20commands%20test&_test_events_running=YES&_test_event_file_created=Pending...&_test_event_file_deleted=Pending...&_test_event_file_content_modified=Pending...&_test_event_folder_created=Pending...&_test_event_folder_deleted=Pending...'
sleep 1

# Make sure test files and folders don't accidentally exist already.
rm CreatedNote.md DeletableNote.md RenameableNote.md MovableNote.md ModifiableNote.md 2> /dev/null
rmdir CreatedFolder DeletableFolder RenameableFolder MovableFolder MoveToHere 2> /dev/null
sleep 1

# Create test files and folders.
touch CreatedNote.md
touch DeletableNote.md
touch RenameableNote.md
touch MovableNote.md
touch ModifiableNote.md
mkdir CreatedFolder
mkdir DeletableFolder
mkdir RenameableFolder
mkdir MovableFolder
mkdir MoveToHere
sleep 1

# Test deleting.
rm DeletableNote.md
rmdir DeletableFolder
# No need to sleep.

# Test modifying content.
echo -ne "---\nyaml_test: testValue\n---\nTest content #tag1 #tag2" > ModifiableNote.md
sleep 1

# Delete files and folders that are not needed anymore.
rm CreatedNote.md ModifiableNote.md
rmdir CreatedFolder
# No need to sleep.

# The following files and folders are still left in place. User should perform tests with them.
# - RenameableNote.md
# - MovableNote.md
# - RenameableFolder
# - MovableFolder
# - MoveToHere

echo "Automatic event tests are complete, now you can do the moving and renaming tests."

# Indicate that test events are not running anymore.
xdg-open 'obsidian://shell-commands/?vault=Shell%20commands%20test&_test_events_running=NO'

# Delete files and folders left from the previous test.
rm RenamedNote.md MoveToHere/MovableNote.md 2> /dev/null
rmdir RenamedFolder MoveToHere/MovableFolder 2> /dev/null
rmdir MoveToHere 2> /dev/null

echo "" >> TestResults.md
echo "> [!SUMMARY] Event tests' results" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Obsidian starts: **"{{_test_event_obsidian_starts}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Switching active pane: **"{{_test_event_switching_pane}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Every n seconds: **"{{_test_event_every_n_seconds}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> File created: **"{{_test_event_file_created}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Folder created: **"{{_test_event_folder_created}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> File deleted: **"{{_test_event_file_deleted}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Folder deleted: **"{{_test_event_folder_deleted}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> File content modified: **"{{_test_event_file_content_modified}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> File renamed: **"{{_test_event_file_renamed}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Folder renamed: **"{{_test_event_folder_renamed}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> File moved: **"{{_test_event_file_moved}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "> Folder moved: **"{{_test_event_folder_moved}}"**" >> TestResults.md
echo "" >> TestResults.md

prompts.title: Test prompt {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}

fields.label: Mandatory field
fields.description: 1. Try to submit the prompt without filling this, ensure an error message is shown saying that this field must be filled. 2. Type value: example

fields.label: Field using variables
fields.description: Check that the value is the current year by default, and then add {{file_name}} to the end (using the file_name variable).

prompts.title: Finish test
prompts.description: {{file_name}} will be renamed according to the input you give here.

fields.label: Test status
fields.description: Type ok if all tests were successful, or FAILED if even just one test failed.

prompts.title: Begin test
prompts.description:
Note that this script overwrites contents of the following files:
 - Sandbox/TestResults.md: The content is emptied.
 - Performed tests/{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md: Possible earlier content is replaced with content from Assets/Templates/Test report.template.md.
prompts.execute_button_text: Create a new test report file

default_value.value: This is a global default value for {{event_title}}.

custom_variables.name: optional_field
custom_variables.description: This should become an empty string.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_1
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_2
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.

custom_variables.name: variable_with_default_value
custom_variables.description: This variable is never planned to be assigned an actual value. It should always fall back to a default value.

default_value.value: This is a global default value for a custom variable.
Obsidian start event is not yet triggered.
Pane switching event is not yet triggered.
Every n seconds event is not yet triggered.
File created event is not yet triggered.
Folder created event is not yet triggered.
File deleted event is not yet triggered.
Folder deleted event is not yet triggered.
File content modified event is not yet triggered.
File renamed event is not yet triggered.
Folder renamed event is not yet triggered.
File moved event is not yet triggered.
Folder moved event is not yet triggered.

custom_variables.name: test_events_running
custom_variables.description: Tells "Every n seconds" and "Switching active pane" event tests whether they can actually report their statuses.

custom_shells.name: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)
custom_shells.description:
"WSL is a feature of Windows that allows developers to run a Linux environment without the need for a separate virtual machine or dual booting." (from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Subsystem_for_Linux)

This custom shell configuration allows you to execute Linux/Bash commands from Obsidian on Windows.

Install WSL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install

custom_shells.name: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) with wrapping test
custom_shells.description:
"WSL is a feature of Windows that allows developers to run a Linux environment without the need for a separate virtual machine or dual booting." (from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Subsystem_for_Linux)

This custom shell configuration allows you to execute Linux/Bash commands from Obsidian on Windows.

Install WSL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install

custom_shells.name: MinGW-w64
custom_shells.description:
"Mingw-w64 is an advancement of the original mingw.org project, created to support the GCC compiler on Windows systems." (from: https://www.mingw-w64.org/)

This custom shell configuration allows you to execute some Linux/Bash commands from Obsidian on Windows.

custom_shells.name: Wine + CMD.EXE
custom_shells.shell_command_test: echo Current working directory: & cd & echo Vault path: {{vault_path}}
